Good game with good charachters. Sad the ending cucks you and alot of questions to be answered. But its overall good. Very optimized on my 2009 Trash of a PC. Hadnt had a crash and ran above 30 fps with an amd a4 6300k and 4gb old ram with a GT 220.

This is a great game with an absolutely enthralling story about different time lines and alternate universes. I highly recommend two playthroughs to fully appreciate the less spelled out and in your face aspects of it. However the person who decided to do away with quick saves and the creation of the Siren boss should get a super hard kick to the balls and then be frozen in place with the Old Man Winter plasmid so everyone can laugh at their expression of pain.
Un gioco meraviglioso e pieno di emozioni, che mantiene col fiato sospeso fino all'ultimo. Un'avventura da vivere al massimo. Consiglio fortemente.

Uno spettacolo di gioco. 
Una trama ricca, intricata e ben articolata, che fa ben gola agli appassionati Nerd come me e ai cultori della Fantascienza. 
Il gameplay Ã¨ ben strutturato e reso agevole: non ho mai avuto frustrazione nel ricominciare alcuni punti. I boss sono collocati nei punti giusti, anche se talvolta i ritmi di lotta possono essere, per taluni, un po' ostici.
Nel complesso, un ottimo titolo, che per chi ha apprezzato i primi due capitoli, non deve mancare nella collezione.

9/10

A wonderful game. To me, it's a new experience since I've never played any titles in the Bioshock franchise before. 
And that experience was great. The graphics can't be as good as that of those new games, but still very beautiful with stunning views, landscapes, etc. The gameplay is similar to other triple-A FPS games, nothing much.

But the plot was the best part of this game. It's quite complicated with those who aren't good with physics in general (like me) but if you do some research, you can understand most of the game. 

9.5/10

Really a great game with beautiful visuals and a compelling story. So, I love The Witchers which have a similar combat/story combo mix, but I hated this game. It just felt like it should have been over like 7 hours before I actually finished it (I played the whole game through in about 22 hours total). I made myself finish it, hoping to be pleasantly surprised by how the story all came together but it was just annoying and over-philosophized in my opinion. I really wanted to like this game. I did like the different vigors and weapons, and for being 5 years old the game still performed pretty well and has ok graphics. But I just hated the story, hated that I spent like 2/3 of the game slogging through bloody streets and blown up machinery (just not a world I enjoyed exploring) and creepy horrible cult crap, and when the credits rolled I wished I had my money and life back.
A good game, but one that ultimately doesn't live up to the legacy of the first two bioshock games. Still heavily enjoyable, but don't expect a masterpiece of storytelling or game design

This is game is a mistake from start to finish. I won't really expand into a neverending wall of text just to say what everyone already said, but in short :

- The story is full of plotholes and makes nonsense. It talks about alternative realities but uses it and incredibly wrong way. It doesn't leads to any moral or general idea or message in any shape or form. It just feels blend and works as an excuse to shot at stuff.

- The gameplay is extremely simplified and have almost no depht or real strategy. Almost every mechanic is overly assisted and casualized. You just have tons of unfair ways of getting ennemies down with your eyes closed. You are 24/7 followed by a character that can litteraly spawn things from thin air and describes it himself as granting wishes : seriously ? This is ridiculous from god's sake. You can play in hard mode and go full braindead mode, you will still be fine.

- The graphics are very polished. From a technical perspective it's magnificent, but yet they somehow managed to make the world blend and mainstream. How could they fail at this with such a concept, this is genius at this point. The first bioshocks were a mix of many genres and that made it very unique. This game is just 1910 in the sky. Wow.

- Lots of unnecessary violence. I am not against violence i love blood and gore, but like everything it needs to be used for a good reason. Previous bioshocks knew that and used it the right way, but this game is immature and abuses from blood just to please the mainstream public. You are litterally walking in an impossible city, i dreamlike wonder full of things to discover, and yet you spend your whole time exploding heads and burning people for no real reason. Very smart.

- This is called bioshock. This is a mistake by itself because it has NO LINK whatsoever with any bioshock you ever played. This is completly standalone. even the most basic idea of water is missing. Even the moral. Not even the basic idea of genetics. The ending tried to justify it but destroyed the plot in doing so, and at this point it's just complete bullsh*t. This game is just out of topic and doesn't diserve this title. It's not a bioshock.

long story short : it's just a mainstream AAA game who stole a popular title name to attract more sells because the game itself struggles a lot just to be acceptable. Gameplay, story, art, ost, technical : they failed everywhere. And now they put adhesive tape on it by calling it bioshock. Even a rushed fanfiction crossover mod could make better. As a bioshock fan i felt insulted with this game. Playing this was a huge disapointement and it clearly was a mistake. Hope there won't be any sequel to bioshock by those devs or editors. It's better for all parties.
